thread.title: LSU to host South Carolina game Saturday; kickoff time is 2:30 p.m.
thread.title_full: LSU to host South Carolina game Saturday; kickoff time is 2:30 p.m.

title: LSU to host South Carolina game Saturday; kickoff time is 2:30 p.m.
text:
LSU quarterback Brandon Harris (6) throws a pass during the first half of the NCAA college football game against Mississippi State in Starkville, Miss., on Sat., Sept 12, 2015, LSU won 21-19. (AP Photo/Jim Lytle) JIM LYTLE — AP 
Its game on at Tiger Stadium on Saturday night. 
A source with knowledge of the situation told The Advocate on Wednesday that the game between the Tigers and Gamecocks will be moved to Baton Rouge in the wake of deadly flooding in Columbia, South Carolina. 
South Carolina confirmed the move with an announcement shortly before 11 a.m. 
Kickoff was announced Wednesday. It is now scheduled for 2:30 p.m. The game was originally scheduled for 11 a.m. CDT on ESPN. 
Though South Carolinas Williams-Brice Stadium was not damaged by the flooding that has plagued the state since the weekend, school officials couldnt guarantee that police and medical staffing, or drinkable water supplies, would be adequate to support the Southeastern Conference game.
